artefact: Child Benefit if your child goes into care

artefact.overview: The rules about Child Benefit if your child goes into care - what you have to do, when payments stop, when you can claim again
artefact.body:
Child Benefit payments usually stop after 8 weeks if your child goes into care - unless it’s because of an illness or a disability.

Tell the Child Benefit Office if your child goes into care - they will tell you if you’ll still get Child Benefit.

You can claim again for Child Benefit after 8 weeks if your child is still in care but at home for either:

  • 7 days or more in a row before going back into care (you can claim Child Benefit for the time they spent at home)
  • at least 24 hours every week (you’ll get Child Benefit as long as that continues)

Child Benefit Helpline
Telephone: 08453 021 444
Textphone: 08453 021 474
8am to 8pm, Monday to Friday
8am to 4pm, Saturday

There are different rules if your child is in residential care or hospital because of an illness or disability.
